verse.roman:
anye 'py evaṁ pratidvandvān
vāyv-agni-varuṇādayaḥ
sūdayām āsur asurān
mṛgān kesariṇo yathā

synonyms: anye—others; api—also; evam—in this way; pratidvandvān—the opposing party of belligerants; vāyu—the demigod known as Vāyu; agni—the demigod known as Agni; varuṇa-ādayaḥ—the demigod known as Varuṇa and others; sūdayām āsuḥ—began to kill vigorously; asurān—all the demons; mṛgān—deer; kesariṇaḥ—lions; yathā—just as.
translation: Vāyu, Agni, Varuṇa and other demigods began killing the demons who opposed them, just as lions kill deer in a forest.
